alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 5:45AM MDT until April 05 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM TODAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK EXCEPT THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west to northwest winds are expected to develop today over northern and central New Mexico. These winds will be combined with minimum relative humidity between 10 and 15 percent, as well as temperatures ranging from 5 to nearly 20 degrees above normal and an unstable airmass, to produce widespread critical fire weather conditions. While critical conditions will diminish later this evening, they are expected to return Wednesday over much of western and central New Mexico where several hours of single digit relative humidity are forecast along with strong northwest winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands below any snowpack, Northeast and East Central Plains from noon today through this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 or 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from around 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains
